title: "European" 1 Figure.
content: Any thoughts on what I call, for lack of a better term, a "European" figure 1 (the one with a more obvious top arm)? How appropriate is it? Should it become the standard, as opposed to this -\> 1? Any advice, technical or otherwise, on the design of this version?
author: A. S. Britton

comments.content: Scott, are you designing something and need this or are you just wondering about the technical name? As far as I know, it is part of the means by which they learn to write the figure 1. I know my Italian cousins all use it.

It's probable that the "European '1'" can have a larger head because/when the "7" has a crossbar.

In terms of type design, the larger head certainly helps when the font is monospaced.

hhp
